28396.description:
It is the turn of the nineteenth century, and mad scientists throughout Europe are competing for the infamy of being the first to create life through the power of alchemy. Using only the raw materials provided by some dubious "Suppliers to the Anatomical Trade", harnessed lightning, and the services of a motley crew of unattractive servants, in It's Alive! you race to collect the eight body parts needed to create your monster and bring it to life. Unfortunately, the local peasants are particularly clumsy and tend to die in freak farming accidents, so the dubious gentlemen rarely find a whole cadaver in sufficiently good condition. Instead, they offer the parts they have managed to salvage. Each turn, you may buy the offered part, sell it to an anatomist for a meager profit, or auction it, trying to get a better deal or rip off your opponents. You might be lucky and get a coffin with a weakling clerk's cadaver in it, which can be used in lieu of any strapping villager's body part, or your involvement in the macabre trade might invoke the villagers' wrath.

Reimplements (and reimplemented by)


The Menorah Game
28396.name: It's Alive!

28397.name: Potretti
28397.description: The idea of the game is to create the family tree of a family together. Players get help from pictures of the members of family that have differing borders and background colors. With this information you are able to see how the genes transfer from generation to generation. In each family there are five generations and the player that first gets rid of his cards is the winner. The Finnish name of the game, Potretti, is an older word for a photo and refers to the pictures of the family members.

28398.description:
Players place ladder and girder cards in a particular pattern on the playing field starting from a girder strip to build a high-rise structure up to Donkey Kong who sits on his cardboard throne. Each time a card is played, the player moves their respective Mario pawn by die count up the card structure.

In addition to the plain ladder and girder cards are obstacle and remedy cards that are self-explanatory. If you're the first player to move your pawn up, above the highest girder where Donkey Kong sits, then you'll capture Donkey Kong and win the game. Oh joy!
28398.name: Donkey Kong Card Game
boardgamepodcastepisode: Episode 8: Arcade Special! Pac-Man, Donkey Kong, and Turtles

28400.name: The Gothic Line
28400.description: The Gothic Line campaign game pits the Allied forces in Northern Italy against German forces desperate to hold the last line of mountains before the Allied forces enter Austria. The German must be very skilled at knowing when to hold and when to run. Delay the Allies long enough and you win.

28401.name: Shirt Tales Card Game
28401.description:
A children's card game. The object of the game is simple enough get 5 cards of the same color or the same animal and you win the round. Win two rounds and you win the game.

The cards feature a monkey, tiger, panda, raccoon, and a mole each wearing blue, yellow, pink, green, and purple shirts. The artwork is simple and appealing to children.

Ages 6 - 10

28402.name: The Golden Egg
28402.description:
The Golden Egg is a childrens' card game set in a traditional farmyard. Players start with a number of tokens and receive a set of cards face down. On their turn a player turns over the top most card from their deck and performs the action written there. This may involve paying tokens into the pool, receiving tokens from the pool, or paying or receiving tokens from the holders of other cards.
When a player turns up an egg card they pay one token into the pool and take the golden egg card irrespective of whether it is still in the middle or held by another player. When the golden goose is turned up the holder of the golden egg wins the pool.
The game can continue a pre-determined number of rounds or until all bar one player are bankrupt.

28403.name: Monopoly: Los Angeles
28403.description: Monopoly edition using Los Angeles attractions in place of the normal street names. (Dodger Stadium and the Memorial Colisseum are Park Place and Boardwalk, for example)

28404.name: Duckopoly
boardgamepublisher: Late for the Sky Production Company
boardgameversion: Late for the Sky Production Company edition
28404.description:
A monopoly (from Greek monos μόνος (alone or single) + polein πωλεῖν (to sell)) exists when a specific person or enterprise is the only supplier of a particular commodity.

Monopoly is a roll-and-move game where players move around the game board buying or trading properties, developing their properties with houses and hotels. When opponents land on players owned property, the owning player collects rent from the landing player. Owning sets of properties increases the rent paid to the player who owns them, by the player who lands on the square. The ultimate goal is to have the most money and drive opponents into bankruptcy.

The University of Oregon version of Late for the Sky's series of college themed Monopoly clones.

28405.name: Monopoly: '84 L.A. Games
28405.description:
A monopoly (from Greek monos μόνος (alone or single) + polein πωλεῖν (to sell)) exists when a specific person or enterprise is the only supplier of a particular commodity.

Monopoly is a roll-and-move game where players move around the game board buying or trading properties, developing their properties with houses and hotels. When opponents land on players owned property, the owning player collects rent from the landing player. Owning sets of properties increases the rent paid to the player who owns them, by the player who lands on the square. The ultimate goal is to have the most money and drive opponents into bankruptcy.

Unofficial Monopoly clone (with a circular board) using locations related to the 1984 Olympics.

28406.description:
Each player in turn must play a suitable card face-up on the discard pile in the center of the table. A card is suitable if it shows the same animal, or has the same color, as the top card of the discard pile.

The player who first manages to get rid of all his cards wins this round and may put his game piece forward one space on the game board. The game is played over several rounds; the player whose piece first reaches the final space on the game board wins the game.
28406.name: Bambino-Solo

28407.name: Build or Bust
28407.description: The object of the game is: to "build" larger and larger houses, changing them from one size to the next. The Player first to complete the final House is the winner. You draw cards in turn and collect or return to the pool - bricks, windows, doors, etc. - as the cards direct. When you think you have all the parts you need, you "Build", but take care and act quickly, or you "Bust".

28408.description:
A different game than Blockhead!, Super Blockhead! includes 30 oddly-shaped wooden pieces and a cardboard base. Players take turns choosing a block to place on the tower, in "any position on any block," somewhat different from the original game.

Players get two chances to allow the tower to tumble; the third time results in being out of the game.
28408.name: Super Blockhead!

28409.name: Computerama
28409.description:
From the Publisher's website:


Computerama is a wacky family computer board game for two to six players, ages 8 to adult. This game combines many exciting features of other well known, and successful games all into one fun-filled event. Is it a Poker game? A Bingo game? Or a Word game? Yes, yes and yes! It’s all those and so much more.

Players are dealt Computerama Cards to start the game. The first player to finish their three cards and get to the Finish space wins the game.

Be careful of the many challenges that can confront you during this game. Don’t get caught between a “Rock, Paper, and Scissors.” Also always know when to “TIC, TAC, or TOE.”

28410.name: Ett litet spel om... schlager
28410.description:
Swedish trivia game with 250 questions about the Eurovision Song Contest.

The questions come in 5 different categories:
1. Winners
2. Lyrics
3. Costumes and Show
4. About the Contest
5. Losers

Box Contents:
- 50 cards with 5 questions each
- 1 card with rules
- 1 card with copyright and disclaimer

28411.name: Travel the World
28411.description:
Draw travel tickets or postcards and use the travel spinner (by air, sea or land) to visit the countries drawn. The first player to visit all their countries and get back to their starting point wins.

The tickets name countries, the postcards name a county's capital and shows a scene from that country.

Teaches familiarity with the world map, country locations and national capitals.

4 games are described. One using tickets to show destinations, one using postcards for destinations, a "pairs" style of game, and postcard/flash card quiz.

Ages 5 and up

28412.name: Oli's Tier Quiz
28412.description:
The name of the game translates to "Oli's animal Quiz".

Oli the lion is main figure of the transmission in the animals and their habitats to be introduced. Popular elements of the series appear also in the play. A child gets quizzed over animals posed and may so long guess/advise like another child necessarily around a action Parcours to go through. Then the roles change. Here the knowledge over animals as well as in demand with the Parcours skill and mobility. Winner who answers the most questions correctly wins.

Age: Ages 8 and up
players: 3 to 5
contents: 90 Quiz cards, 9 action maps, 1 moderator map, 3 lion paws, 1 jungle longitudinal dimension.

28413.description:
The name of the game translates to "Smart color queue".

For the preparatory school - recognize colors

Putting play around recognizing color successions

The players set alternating Farbkarten on the queue. Everyone tries to put the color sequences which are shown on the small cards lying before it. There it means watched out! The queue will look ever longer and all players strained, which colors to line up gradually together.
28413.name: Schlaue Farben-Schlange

28414.name: Meine erste Verkehrs-Schule
28414.description:
The name of the game translates to "My first traffic school".

Fast perception and reaction are needed in order to play this game which deals with road safety training for children.

The game comes with, among other things, four thrill whistles and a very beautifully illustrated solution poster With the addition of four play variants "Meine erste Verkehrs-Schule ----SCOUT - my first traffic school" helps children Ages 5 and up deal with situations involving being around traffic. Players discover what is the right or wrong behavior while being near or in traffic. Those conditions are described on "small traffic condition cards". In addition children become acquainted with the meanings of many road signs.

Contents: 1 small plastic car, 1 small plastic horn, 34 situation small cards, 14 small road sign cards, 14 pasteboard traffic signs, 1 solution poster, 1 rule book

28415.description:
Themed around a horse race, players place bets before a wheel is spun and the result determined and bets paid out.

The game has been described as a themed version of Roulette with less betting options.
boardgameversion: F. H. Ayres Red Square Box edition
28415.name: Sandown

boardgamehonor: 2006 Japan Boardgame Prize Best Childgame Nominee
28416.description:
Which animal neighs, has a long mane, and wears shoes?

One player describes or imitates an animal, and the others try to guess which animal it is. When they have guessed, they must select the correct bottom from the animal cards on the table.

There are two game variants:

for age three: an older games master describes the animal and the younger players trying to grab it off the table
for age four and up: players take it in turns to draw one of the small animal counters and describe the animal to other players. if they succeed both the describer and the guesser get a point.
28416.name: Picco Popolino

28417.name: Megavisa
28417.description: Based on a quiz show that ran in Finnish television in the early 90s.

28418.description: 2-4 four players move their pieces around concentric circles and towards the center spot. Moves can be sliding one space around a circle, or jumping over another piece towards the center. Players get points by capturing (landing on) an opponents piece, or by "rescuing" (landing on) their own piece in the center.
28418.name: Archos

28419.name: Don't Blow Your Top
28419.description:
From the box:

"Careful! Careful! You never know,
The one you add may make it blow!"

A spinner is used to determine how many marbles each player in turn must drop in a hat that sits on top of a balloon-man's head. Small strips with a texture resembling extremely rough sandpaper are attached under the hat; these sit gently on the surface of the balloon-head. At some point, the weight of the marbles becomes too much and the hat-strips pop the balloon. The winner is the person with the fewest marbles in their posession when the balloon bursts.

The game was designed by the well-known Marvin Glass & Associates design studio.

28420.name: Skull & Bones: A World of Pirates
28420.description:
A mixture of history and myth, Skull & Bones: A World of Pirates is the new strategy board game from the history geeks who brought you the acclaimed Galactic Destiny.

2-6 players are the Captains of a crew of pirate scum! Travel the seas with an innovative knot system, raid ports, cargo fleets and other pirates.

Pillage, raid and gain renown: Fame, Fear, Fortune -- who will be the most dreaded dog of the sea. Includes exciting rules for in game gambling!

28421.name: Smallville Board Game
28421.description:
Smallville is a copyrighted property. This is an unauthorised, unofficial game produced merely for the entertainment of fans and is non-profit making.

"Agents of the evil Kryptonian known as Zod have arrived on Earth and have disguised themselves as Kal-El of Krypton, who goes by the identity of Clark Kent. The agents of Zod each want to convince Clark Kent’s friends and family that THEY are the real Clark. In doing this the agents of Zod can banish the real Clark (Kal-El) and with him gone, the Earth will be theirs"

In this FREE 'Print and Play' board game players will battle villains to save their friends and earn valuable respect points.

All the files you need to play are available on the NEW and improved website below.

http://mmboardgames.page.tl/

28422.description:
For 2 - 4 players Ages 3 and up.

The Very Quiet Cricket Board Game is a spin and move game based on the Eric Carle book "The Very Quiet Cricket". Players start as newly hatched crickets and move from leaf to leaf in a journey to meet new friends and find their voice. Children learn about persistence, individuality, growth and love in this colorful game. Includes game board, 4 cricket game pieces, 24 insect cards, spinner and instructions. 2 to 4 Players.
28422.name: The Very Quiet Cricket Game

28423.name: FamilyLore
28423.description:
from the games website:

FamilyLore, a new board game that centers around the players’ family history, genealogy, ancestors and traditions, encourages families to bond and share stories together … so every player is a winner.

FamilyLore Game is a unique board game for YOUR family. Unique because the game changes and grows as your family plays. FamilyLore Game is based on themes familiar to all families--and to other groups that have a shared history.

Players move around the board by answering questions about the family. These questions are organized around 20 themes.

Of the 600 Story Cards that are part of the game, 300 have questions to help you get underway. The remaining Story Cards provide players with a chance to write questions unique to them.

Serendipity spaces are at each corner of the board. When a player lands on one, s/he takes a Serendipity Card and follows its directions.

The first player to complete five trips around the board wins the game. Except, this is a game where everyone who plays wins because every player gets to tell his or her favorite family stories.

28424.name: Napoleonic Quick March
28424.description:
Napoleonic Quick March is an army level command game with corps and divisions as the major maneuver elements. Players dice for initiative order, draw command cards that act as division and corps commander interpretations of battle orders. Each player moves divisions in an attempt to affect a combined arms attack.

Novelty is the grid movement system where the board is divided into a point grid system. It allows complex maneuver similar to standard "measure and move" miniature games, but needs no rulers. Allows for more dynamic play than hexagonal grids with eight possible positions rather than six.

Major battles of the era can be played rather quickly, and a small number of troops are needed. It is an excellent game for beginners to get into the era, and it has enough complexity to keep veteran gamers interested.

The rules are full color, brief, well written, and easy to follow. Rule book includes a sample scenario in the back along with scenario building guide and open gaming army development matrix. Rules include basic and advanced rules, command cards, and quirky illustrations that bring a smile.

Bottom line is game is fast and entertaining.

28425.name: Beach Music Trivia
28425.description:
Made by ERH in 1985 for 2-4 single players or any combination of teams.

Features 1000 Beach and Shag music questions!

OBJECT: Test your knowledge of Beach Music with this exciting game. It provides hours of fun as players try to answer question while avoiding such hazards as hang over, high tide, and too much sun. The first player to reach the condo and correctly answer a question wins!

Contents include: 250 cards, 4 pawns, 1 die, game board, and the cardboard insert.

28426.name: Le grand jeu du cyclotourisme
28426.description:
From the Publisher:

"For the last 72 years, cycle tourists from all over the world have covered the PARIS-BREST-PARIS cross country cycle ride, 1200 Km to be run in less than 90 hours, passing through forests, towns and villages of 9 Districts. This is what the organizers of this exceptional meeting offer you: the opportunity to participate in the official PARIS-BREST-PARIS-Randonneur board game.

The objective is to be the player who achieves the best time in completing the PARIS-BREST-PARIS circuit, a journey consisting of some 1200 Km (750 miles). The player is expected to avoid the many pitfalls of the route, to arrive at control points within the required time, to achieve a good average time, to not waste time at controls points and to persevere despite the sometimes adverse weather conditions and other hazards which will get in their way!

A second objective of the game is to see which players can get all of their team past the finish line in Saint-Quentin-en-Yvelines intact.

The game is played in two sequences: 1) The practice Lap at St. Quentin-en-Yvelines, 2) The Paris-Brest-Paris-Randonneur."

28427.name: Columbusopoly
28427.description:
Made by World-Opoly in 1990 for 2 or more players ages 7 and up.

A community spirit game, custom designed to create the unique character of Columbus.

OBJECT: Players enter the game as visitors to Columbus. As players travel around the board, they have the opportunity to buy, sell, and trade properties. The winner has the opportunity to stay as a resident, while the others must pack their bags and leave town.

COMPLETE contents include: game board, 2 dice, 4 pawns, business license cards, sunny money, surprise cards, treasure chest cards, branches and corporate offices, and the instructions printed on the insert.

28428.description:
The Battle of Reichshoffen, also known as Froeschwiller or Woerth, was one of France's early disasters in the disastrous Franco-Prussian War. It is most notable for a desperate and futile charge by the French cuirassiers and for a children's song that begins C'était au soir d'la bataille de Reichshoffen.

The scale of Reichshoffen 1870 is the same as Solferino 1859 (600 meters/hex, 1 hour/turn, units are brigades). The rules vary only slightly: French defensive fire and Prussian artillery are both more effective than in the earlier game, reflecting the two nations' technical advances in small arms and cannon, respectively. French heavy cavalry have two opportunities per game for a charge à la mort, which can strike anywhere within five hexes of a French headquarters - usually without effect but useful if saved for just the right opportune moment.

Other rules changes are based on the armies' command problems. The French army has no commander-in-chief. Marshal Mac Mahon, the hero of the Battle of Magenta, "although physically present on the battlefield did not direct the battle". As a consequence, French formations can act effectively only by passing initiative tests. (Optional rules give the Marshal a chance to be slightly or fully effective.) On the Prussian side, there was quite a lot of initial confusion; brigades cannot launch coordinated attacks until the commander-in-chief, Prince Frederick William, arrives on the scene halfway through the action.

The battle begins at 8:30 am and lasts for 10 hourly turns. The victory conditions are simple: The Prussians must occupy four villages in the center of the map; otherwise the French win. The map is slightly less than half the old Vae Victis standard, sharing a sheet with the one for Magenta 1859. The counters must be mounted and cut apart.
28428.name: Reichshoffen 1870
boardgamefamily: Les Grandes Batailles de Napoleon III

28429.description:
The Battle of Magenta, June 4, 1859, was the first major clash between France and Austria during the Second Italian War of Independence. Magenta 1859 recreates it using the same rules as Solferino 1859 and Reichshoffen 1870, as well as the same scale (one hour per turn, 600 meters per hex, brigades). Unlike its siblings, the game has almost no special rules.

Napoleon III commands the French and, though scarcely comparable to his uncle, well overmatches the Austrians' sluggish and late arriving Count Gyulai. Unfortunately for the French, Napoleon enters far away from the bulk of his forces and takes a long time to get within command range. Until then, formations may move effectively only when their commanders make successful initiative rolls, and the largest French corps suffers from an initiative penalty for the first several hours. (Its commander, General Mac Mahon, moved slowly while waiting for a Sardinian division to come up to cover his open flank. This caution did not, however, prevent him from becoming the hero of the day. The Emperor rewarded him with the title "duc de Magenta".)

The battle starts at 10:00 a.m. and lasts 10 turns, with many brigades not arriving until the afternoon. The forces (and the map) are only about half the size of those in Solferino, and the victory conditions are simpler: Each side gets one Victory Point for each hex it holds in the town of Magenta (which has three) plus one for each demoralized enemy corps.
28429.name: Magenta 1859
boardgamefamily: Les Grandes Batailles de Napoleon III

28430.description:
(from the rulebook :)

Commandos Sur Saint-Nazaire is a solitary game, it simulates the British commando raid on St Nazaire on 27-28th March 1942.
28430.name: Commandos Sur Saint-Nazaire

28431.description: This expansion to the Disposable Heroes and Coffin For Seven Brothers system adds details for including the Fighting Men of the British Commonwealth in your games.
28431.name: Disposable Heroes and Coffin for Seven Brothers: Go Forward Together
boardgameexpansion: Disposable Heroes and Coffin For Seven Brothers

28432.description: This expansion to the Disposable Heroes and Coffin For Seven Brothers system adds details for including German Armed forces in your games.
28432.name: Disposable Heroes and Coffin for Seven Brothers: Angriff!
boardgameexpansion: Disposable Heroes and Coffin For Seven Brothers

28433.name: Dial N Spell
28433.description:
Made by Milton Bradley in 1961 for Ages 4 - 8.

Have fun. Dial each word letter by letter, arrow points to matching letter. Learn to spell 99 words!

Contents are: cardboard insert, spinner/dialer and extra cards (5 double sided).

28434.name: Luft Krieg
28434.description:
From the publisher's Website:

Luft Krieg is a tabletop air combat wargame set in an alternate world where the wonders of pulp science-fiction magazines are realities of science. Players take the part of commanders guiding their daring aces through aerial battles inspired by the Second World War. This book includes basic rules and counters to take control of the air forces of any one of five powerful nations to help decide the fate of the Free World.

Luft Krieg uses the same system as the Gear Krieg Wargame.

28435.name: Destination Paris
28435.description:
Destination Paris is an award winning souvenir game. From the back of the box:
DESTINATION is the award winning fast moving Taxi game that will take you on a journey through the streets of Paris in your very own cab!
As the driver you will visit famous destinations in the city, collecting fares and trying to avoid the traffic lights. You must not run out of fuel, or lose your license and be careful not to upgrade to a Turbo Taxi too quickly as you could run out of cash and may need a logbook loan to bail you out!
The aim of this game is to be the player with the highest earnings... if you survive the shift!

boardgameimplementation: Deutschland: Finden Sie Minden? Pocket Edition
Die Welt: Singapur, wo liegt das nur?
Die Welt: Wetten, da liegt Manhattan!
28436.description:
Deutschland: Finden Sie Minden is a trivia game focusing on German topography. Players draw cards describing towns, popular sights or landmarks, etc. and are then asked to pinpoint them on the game board which is a map of Germany. However, no place names are included on the map.

The map is divided into several zones of varying sizes. Players can try to gain more points by choosing a smaller (thus more concrete) zone, or play it safe, by only choosing a general area (larger zone) for the location in question.
28436.name: Deutschland: Finden Sie Minden

28437.name: Terminator 2: Year of Darkness
28437.description:
A Miniature Combat System based on the Terminator storyline.
Humans fight machines in the desolate landscapes of future earth.

28438.name: Asterix to the Rescue
28438.description:
Featuring the best-selling comic character Asterix, this is an interesting riff on choose your own path books. Rather than just work through the choices in the book, the player is using the book and attempting to transverse a map. Another difference from typical choose your own path games, the player can gain and use a number of cards, like magic potions and a coin bag. In addition, some of the paths available are determined by a die roll.

The game comes with a die featuring many of the Asterix characters. In addition, the game comes with a clever cipher and code breaking card. One more difference between typical choose your own path books, this one is a weighty 284 pages.

From the cover, "Use your skill to help Asterix outwit the Romans - before his magic potions run out!"

28439.name: Disney's Cartoon Classics
28439.description:
The video board game featuring Mickey, Donald, and friends. With actual footage from Disney’s animated classic cartoons. There are three games that can be played, Mickey’s Bingo, Feeling Ducky, and Every Which Way.

Made by Milton Bradley in 1986 for 1-3 players Ages 3 - 6.

Contents include: VHS tape, 3 two-sided game boards, 48 character tokens, 2 decks of 30 cards, 1 deck of 24 cards, cardboard insert, and the instructions.

28440.name: Change
28440.description:
A tactical game with black and white wooden chips players try to collect.

In the beginning, in front of each player lies as a row of mixed up black and white chips. According to different "formulas" printed on cards, players may trade a row of chips (e.g. black-white-white-black) for a different set (e.g. black-black-black). When a formula card is used it is discarded and a new one is drawn.
Making skillful use of the "currency" allows players to change chips as long as they end up having collected chips of only one color - they win!

28443.name: The Land Before Time: Escape from Red Claw Game
28443.description: Based on Cartoon Network’s “The Land Before Time” TV series, this board game allows players to role play as their favorite dinosaur characters: Littlefoot, Ducky, Cera, Chomper and Red Claw. Littlefoot and his friends are trying to get to the Great Valley, but Red Claw tries to keep them back. The first player who reaches the Great Valley wins.

28444.name: Chaotic
28444.description:
Chaotic is a collectible trading card game in the similar vein as the popular game Yu-Gi-Oh.

The game allows 2 players to use fantastic creatures to battle each other across a triangular playing surface. Upon winning a battle, the winning creature can advance deeper into the ranks of the defending player's legion to strike at a new level of creatures.

One main feature of the game is that Chaotic cards all come with a unique code that the owner can use on a special website (www.chaoticgame.com) to unlock a virtual version of that card. In this way, the player is provided with a virtual copy of their entire card collection.

28445.name: Galloping Ghost!
28445.description:
Galloping Ghosts was made by Lakeside for 2 or more players Ages 8 and up.

COMPLETE contents include: 1 revolving/spinning tray, 4 tablets, 4 colored pencils, and 4 ghost markers.
Objective: To not complete any words during the game. Players must drop out of the game when they form their 5th word.

Each player writes the first letter of a word with his colored pencil on the tablet in his writing section. When all players have written their letter, the tray that moves the tablets is turned left in the direction of the arrows so the tablets move to the next position around the table.

Players add a letter to the new tablet in their writing section. The letters in sequence should be part of a legal word. Game play continues as players add a new letter each turn to each combination of letters on the tablets. Players CANNOT "pass" a turn at any time. Each player uses a different colored pencil, so a missing color on any tablet can easily be spotted and quickly identified

When a player is forced to complete a word he moves his ghost marker to the next letter on his "ghostboard". He then runs a line through the completed word on the tablet. The tray is turned and the next player starts a new word on the tablet (the rest of the letter groups stay as they are).

Players should always have a word in mind as they play because they may be challenged at any time.

28446.name: At Close Quarters
boardgamepublisher: HLBS Publishing (The Honourable Lead Boiler Suit Company)
28446.description: Skirmish Wargame rules for 20th to early 21st century special forces operations and other small unit actions.

28447.name: American Trivia Challenge: Tennessee Edition
28447.description:
This game is the Tennessee Edition of the American Trivia Challenge line of games. The questions are divided into multiple categories, including:
1. Business
2. People, Places, and Things
3. Arts & Sciences
4. Government & History
5. Fun & Games
6. Etcetera
7. Home State

The players must move around the board, correctly answering questions at each category stop along the way.
The game includes: 1 playing board, 1 numeral die, 1 compass die, 6 game pieces, 6 flag holders, 4800 trivia questions, and 800 home state questions.

28448.name: Kampfgruppe Zwei
28448.description:
Kampfgruppe Zwei is the second volume of a series of books which attempt to present a system for accurately representing combat during the Second World War from the perspective of small units and individuals. This title places it's emphasis on the wide variety of ground vehicles which were involved in the conflict. Whilst it is perfectly capable of being played as a 'stand alone' system in it's own right by those who are exclusively interested in vehicle combat, it is also designed to fully integrate with the companion volume 'Kampfgruppe Eins' (Infantry Combat) for those who wish to explore joint operations between the two arms.

All that is required to play are models to represent the appropriate vehicles and terrain, a suitable playing area, six sided dice and a measuring device. Players are then at liberty to recreate combat involving motorcycles, Tiger tanks and everything in between.

28449.name: Kampfgruppe Drei
28449.description:
The third in the Kampfgruppe system series, this volume covers weapon systems such as mortars, which provided infantry units with their own integral 'artillery' support (down to platoon level in most armies). It also considers rockets, which were frequently employed in the close support role during street fighting and 'bunker busting' operations along with various other weapons.

A ready reference section is provided to maintain the flow of play when major aspects of the various procedures need to be confirmed. A section is also presented dealing with defensive works along with scenario ideas and tactical information relating to attacks made against them.

28450.name: Kampfgruppe Vier
28450.description: By using the contents of this volume in conjunction with other 'Kampfgruppe' titles actions such as raids by commando or airborne units can be recreated from landing. Larger scenarios might involve amphibious landings in the Mediterranean or 'island hopping' in the Pacific. On a more routine level, the various sections of this volume can be employed to provide air and 'off table' artillery support during predominantly land actions. Similarly, come of the specialized combat engineering vehicles developed for the Normandy landings can be used to assist in overcoming difficulties further inland, as occurred in the actual conflict. In common with its companion titles, Kampfgurppe Vier is fully compatible with all other aspects of the'Kampfgruppe' system and can be employed fully, or in part, to suit the specific requirements of players.

28451.name: Baptism of Fire II
28451.description:
From the publisher's Website

Baptism of Fire II, BoF II, is a complete revision and overhaul of the original ‘Baptism of Fire’ (BoF) and ‘Wild Fire’ (WF) miniature wargames. The result will seem familiar to players of these first games, but in many of the mechanisms and details there has been change.

The changes have made for standardized systems, which are both easy to teach and remember in play. The text is clearer with more and better examples. It has also been organized by a group of players like yourself, so hopefully finding information in a hurry will be easier.

BoF II continues as a leading miniature skirmish game, for games of Squads up to reinforced Platoon level from WW2 to present day. It includes rules for all manner of infantry and vehicle operations. There are additional optional rules to further enhance the gaming experience.

The rules are aimed to create as authentic a battlefield experience as possible, players are encouraged to utilize real life battlefield strategies and tactics as these will give great success.

BoF II continues using a similar system as Baptism of Fire and Wild Fire to create a highly interactive, unpredictable, yet the player can try and exert a degree of control and planning to implement his strategies and tactics.

boardgamehonor: 2012 Charles S. Roberts Best Desktop Published (DTP) / Print-and-Play / Postcard Game Nominee
28452.description:
Valor & Victory is a game of WWII Squad-Level Combat

Through the shattered ruins of a quaint European village, to the scorched sands of North Africa, and on the deadly beaches of a mist-shrouded Pacific island, Valor & Victory puts you in command of the troops and machines that fought across the battlefields of World War II.

Valor & Victory is a fast playing, easy to learn World War II squad-level game system. V&V gets you into the action quickly, without requiring you to learn a lot of minutiae and unnecessary detail. But don't let that fool you — Valor & Victory is a complete WWII wargaming system, covering infantry and armored combat, artillery and air strikes, snipers, close assaults, armored overruns, fortifications, and much more!

Valor & Victory may be easy to learn, but it's challenging and fun. So whether you're looking for an evening of serious wargaming action, or simply a quick battle at lunch, Valor & Victory delivers!

New players are advised to download a limited set of files to try 3 scenarios, before deciding to dive deeper into the game.
See below in the "Community Wiki" section.
28452.name: Valor & Victory

28453.name: Wild Fire
28453.description:
From the intro:

Wild Fire, or WF, is a table top miniature wargame for 10-30 mm figures. It is focussed on reinforced platoon level skirmish games, and is suitable for one off games, or campaigns, but can be used to play games as small as squad size. It uses the same system as Baptism of Fire.

It's been reprinted together with the WWII rules in Baptism of Fire II.

28454.name: The New Yorker: Cartoon Caption Game
28454.description:
Each player writes a caption to a cartoon from New Yorker magazine. Whomever is "it" this turn guesses who wrote each one. Players score for guessing right and for fooling others. Like Balderdash, only much funnier!

from the publisher:

Based on The New Yorker’s popular Cartoon Caption Contest comes a game of immeasurable creativity, unmatched wit, and uproarious humor…and you are responsible for, well, most of it.

If a picture speaks a thousand words, surely you can come up with a few of your own in this hilarious game of ‘which player wrote which caption’. And don’t worry about not being funny. In a game like this, even the ‘bad’ captions are part of the fun!

28455.name: Saurian Safari
boardgamepublisher: HLBS Publishing (The Honourable Lead Boiler Suit Company)
28455.description: Being a set of miniatures rules for hunting dinosaurs and other prehistoric creatures in an alternate reality.

28456.name: Rattenkrieg
28456.description:
From the intro:

"Rattenkrieg" is designed as a stand alone game system that allows players to recreate fighting in built up areas during the Second World War. However, because it is based on the popular, tried and tested 'Kampfgruppe' series it is also compatible with the rest of Dropwing's World War Two titles, allowing scenarios of infinite variety to be created.

Urban fighting is held by many to be one of the most challenging aspects of modern warfare and this is equally reflected by the challenge of representing such combat on the war games table. This volume enables various types of infantry and vehicles to test their mettle against some of the unique situations to be encountered whilst fighting in built up areas.

Some of the most significant battles of the Second World War were fought in urban surroundings, such as Berlin, the Warsaw Uprising and perhaps most notably Stalingrad. However, it should also be remembered that, in addition to such epic and historically significant encounters, countless smaller actions took place within the towns and villages along the paths of advance made at all stages of the war. The prime purpose of "Rattenkrieg" is to enable this style of combat, along with its unique atmosphere and challenges, to be recreated on the tabletop.

Special procedures are presented to incorporate sniper duels, sewer fighters and tank hunting teams, in addition to more mainstream combatants. Ready reference sheets are printed on facing pages and due to the comb binding the book can be opened flat to speed up play by having all of the main procedures available at a glance.

"Rattenkrieg" also includes a scenario based on an historical event, which can be used to introduce new players to the game as well as form a basis for experiment with various aspects of the game.

28458.description:
Road Cycling Tour (RCT) is a road cycling simulation focusing on team tactics in multi-stage races. By means of road/track tiles stages can be built to simulate real or imaginary cycling events. Movement is modified roll-and-move with some additional rules for breakaways and closing gaps (as a simulation of slipstreaming). The characteristics or qualities of the cyclists/riders are represented with 'speed counters' that can be used to replace or in addition to the dice. Teams should generally have a balanced mix of riders with different specializations represented by different sets of speed counters.

A 'beginners' game' and rules for time trials, team time trials, and some advanced and optional rules are included with the game, but given the flexible nature of the game, players can easily make further adaptations to simulate their favorite cycling event. To further explain the most complex rules, a series of picture tutorials can be found in the 'rules forum' here.

RCT is not a short game. It is recommended to play at least 5 stages in a single game, and with 2 experienced players, that would take between 2 and 3 hours. More players and more (and/or longer) stages make the game longer, smaller teams make it shorter but have a negative effect on possible team tactics. However, RCT is played stage by stage, and it would be easy to play different stages on different occasions.

The game is a free download. All necessary files are available in the files section here.
28458.name: Road Cycling Tour

28460.name: Football Tactics
28460.description:
Made by John Kovach Co. in 1980 for Ages 8 and up.

Contents include: 14 men, 1 football, 1 scoreboard, 1 game board, cardboard insert, and the numbers on the back of the men.

28461.name: Flash Match VCR Jr.
28461.description:
Made by Mattel in 1996 for 2-4 players Ages 10 and up.

A rapid fire memory challenge.

COMPLETE contents include: 1 VHS tape, 1 large playing deck, colored chips, plastic insert, and the instructions.

Test your memory and bluffing skills. Match cards from your hand to pictures, which flash on the screen, to win more cards. The player with the most cards, when the deck runs out, wins the game.

28462.name: Micro Force: The Game American Civil War
28462.description:
From Back of Cover
Take command of a division in the Civil War with this fast-playing and fun system for tactical combat simulation. It has everything: rules, tables, a scenario generator plus a collection of prepared scenarios featuring many of the most popular battles of "The War Between the States."
- Game Rules and Tables for 10mm Miniatures
- Weapons Data for Artillery & Small Arms
- Scenario Design Guide
- 11 Ready-to-Play Historical Scenarios

SCALES:
1 infantry stand = +/- 70 men
1 cannon = a section (2 guns)
1" = 25 yards or meters
Typical 2 player game: 4' x 4' board; 2-3 hours

[Though a stand represents around 70 men, casualties are recorded for each half-stand. Thus a 5-stand regiment has 10 steps]

28463.name: Bodycheck
28463.description:
Both players try to lead their ice hockey team to victory.

The game's idea separates this game from other tactics and sports games:

Bodycheck. An on ice player may be moved only if he crosses the direct line between two players and their movement.

The movement possibilities of the skater do not depend the player's strengths but only on his position on game board. This underlines the team play aspect and creates an unusual play feeling for the game.

Source: Spielbox magazine

28464.name: Dragon Dynasty Collectible Card Game
28464.description:
A CCG featuring all the mythical and historical Chinese heroes. There's Cao Cao from the Three Kingdoms; Lin Chung from the Water Margin; the Monkey King from Journey to the West; Bruce Lee etc.

The Starter Set kicked off with "Three Kingdoms I".

Following the Starter Set is "Expansion Set 1 : Water Margin I".

28465.name: MaravilloZoo
28465.description:
Canal 13 (Channel 13) and Ludik Toys have together developed a fantastic game based completely on the popular MaravilloZoo program.
The wonderful thing about this game is that, as in the TV show, you can learn a lot of interesting things about the animal kingdom.

CONCEPT OF THE GAME: Each participant must compete showing his knowledge about the Animal Kingdom. For it, they will have to:

answer questions or
fulfill the challenges proposed in the game:
draw an animal
make charades of an animal
explain an animal
mention animals that fulfill certain characteristics
discover an animal playing the "hanged person"
etc.





A game for the whole family

28467.name: Match Mate
28467.description: Match Mate is a couples game featuring over 1,000 provocative questions in the categories of “Memory”, “Personality”, “Sensuality” and “Odds and Ends.” This game allows couples to see how well they really know each other.

28468.name: Monster Mansion
28468.description:
Players move their pawns carefully through the haunted house gameboard in search of four different color treasures. When a player lands on one of the 40 face-down tokens on the gameboard, they flip it over where they might discover a treasure, a helpful token or...horrors, even a monster!

Classic Universal Monsters 'The Mummy', 'Mr.Hyde', 'Creature from the Black Lagoon', 'Dracula', 'Phantom of the Opera', 'Frankenstein' and 'Wolfman' are all hidden on the gameboard ready to scare or take your treasure. Once a monster has been turned over, any player may move the monster from room to room to look for an opponent. Once four different color treasures have been collected, make a break for one of the mansion exits to win the game!

28469.name: Surf's Up: Big Wave Game
28469.description:
From the Press Release:

Based on Sony’s star-studded CGI film “Surf’s Up” due in theaters nationwide in June 2007, this game will give everyone a sneak peak. Players must try to get their four penguins over the wave to the other side of the beach, but big penguins can keep the smaller ones from getting too far and the wave is unpredictable.

28470.name: Horseland: Blue Ribbon Day Game
28470.description:
From the Press Release:

Visitors of the Horseland Web site, one of the top Web sites for girls with more than 3 million on-line users, and fans of the “Horseland” Saturday-morning television series can share their enthusiasm for horses with this board game. Players select their horses and try to earn points in different categories and compete to be the first player to get a blue ribbon.

28471.name: Ben 10 Total Transformation Game
28471.description:
From the Press Release:

Gives players an opportunity to role play as Ben Tennyson, star of Cartoon Network’s “Ben 10.” Using a replica of Ben’s Omnitrix, players must find out what alien they’ve become and then use that power to battle and get closer winning.

28472.name: Scooby-doo! Haunted House 3D Board Game
28472.description:
From the Press Release:

Fans of Cartoon Network’s Scooby-Doo! TV series can join in the adventures with this 3D action game. Players move around the haunted house and must avoid secret booby traps, like a moving ghost night, a creaky staircase and a haunted moose head. The player who reaches the top first wins.

Fan Home Page: http://www.scoobydoohauntedhouse.com

28473.name: Hide and Seek
28473.description:
An interactive children's memory game. Taking turns each player tries to find a matching 'Crazy Creature' which matches the Hide and Seek card. If a player successfully finds a match they can move 'IT' one space closer to their opponents Gotcha circle. When 'IT' reaches either players Gotcha circle the other player is the winner.

This game simulates a game of hide and seek and allows the players to interact with each other using phrases like 'You're it' and 'Gotcha'.

---

Find the hidden creatures to win this easy to play memory game.
For 2 players aged 4 years upwards

A game for 2 players aged 4 onwards.
OBJECT:
To keep out of the CAUGHT YOU space by selecting the correct hiding Crazy Creature.

PREPARATION:
1. Place the playing strip on the table with the yellow CAUGHT YOU space in front of one player sitting one side of the table and the blue CAUGHT YOU space in front of the other, sitting opposite.
2. Attach MR. IT to his stand and place him on the start facing the yellow end of the playing strip.
3. The player at the yellow and of the playing strip takes the eight HIDING PLACE cards with the yellow sky and places them lace (CRAZY CREATURE SIDE) down spread out in a straight line in front of him. The player at the blue and does the same with the blue cards.
4. The Crazy Creature cards are shuffled and stacked face down on the table between the two rows of HIDING PLACE cards.
5. The top Crazy Creature card is turned over, showing the players which creature they are looking for, and the game i.e. ready to begin.

HOW TO PLAY
The player on the yellow side of the playing strip starts by reaching over and turning one of his opponent's HIDING PLACE cards over to find the Crazy Creature of the same colour as on the card in the centre. If the creature on the HIDING PLACE card does not match he turns the "HIDING PLACE" card back over and his turn ends. The player on the blue side now turns one of his opponent’: HIDING PLACE cards to find the same Crazy Creature.
When a player turns a HIDING PLACE card and finds the matching Crazy Creature, he yells YOU'RE IT and turns MR. IT to face his opponent and moves MR. lT one step towards his opponent's CAUGHT YOU space. The hiding place card is left face up. He then turns over a new Crazy Creature card in the centre and goes again, looking for the next Crazy Creature.
If all 8 Crazy Creature cards in the centre have been turned over before MR. IT gets to a CAUGHT YOU space, the Crazy Creature cards are re-shuffled and placed face down between the players. The players then turn all hiding place cards Crazy Creature side down and rearrange them. The last player to find the hiding Crazy Creature continues the play and turns over the top Crazy Creature card in the centre.

When a player moves MR. IT into his opponent's CAUGHT YOU space, he wins the game.

28474.description:
This expansion is part of the second set of Age of Steam expansions designed by the Steam Brothers.

The India map is the result of the requests we had from many people to have maps that keeps the feeling of the basic map. The new rules are simple but the result is a challenging map. The main new rules concerns the production rule and the moonsoon that affects your economy

Austria is a 2 player only map and originally appeared in 2005 as part of Age of Steam Expansion: Austria, Switzerland & The Netherlands. It features a completely changed economy with no shares available and three goods shipment phases. This map combines the excellent 2-players rule set by John Bohrer with the Steam Brothers design. Many thanks to John Bohrer for his incredible support!
28474.name: Age of Steam Expansion: Austria & India

28475.name: Vegas Nite Bingo
28475.description: Vegas Nite Bingo is played with a 56 card deck. Each card has a bingo letter and three numbers. The object is to play cards in front of you that spell BINGO. All players are dealt five cards. One player begins as the caller and turns over the top card in the deck. She then choses one of the three numbers on that card and "calls" that number. For instance O-43. Any players who have cards that match that number can play them in front of them and draw a new card. The caller does have a hand and can choose the number to call based on their cards. Play proceeds until a FREE card is drawn. When this happens the caller plays it as her own and any other FREE card is discarded, the deck then moves to the player on the left and they become the caller.

28476.description: Players attempt to score goals by rolling three dice and moving a ball peg on a peg board. There is a different die for passes, shots and kicks.
28476.name: Playoff Soccer

28477.name: Mini Golf
28477.description: Using three dice players play a three hole course moving ball pegs on a peg board. There are different dice for woods, irons, and a putter.

28478.name: Super Speedway
28478.description: Players roll dice to move their car pegs around the track peg board. There are different dice for aggressive and normal racing and a pit stop die. This game is a very simple Indy style track on which you move a peg from hole to hole:- 7 per lap. Each player sticks to their own lane and has their own die which gives one of +1,+2,+3,-1,PIT,MISS. If in the pit, you use a pit die to decide whether or not you come out or stay there awhile.

28479.name: Monopoly: New Disney
28479.description:
This new edition of the previous limited edition has some new features and some rule changes which alter the traditional game.
1. As well as eight (8) Collectible playing pieces, including Snow White and Pinnochio, there is also a gold statuette of Tinkerbell. In a significant new rule change, when a player rolls a double Tinkerbell advances on to the next property. If a player lands on this property and it is already owned, then the Bank pays the fine. If the property is not owned then the player purchases it for free!
2. Magic Moments and Show Time cards replace Chance and Community Chest and are pleasantly well-themed.
3. Gameboard spaces contain the Disney films as the properties you are buying. In the center of the board is a magnificent pop-up Disney-style castle.
4. Stations have been replaced by modes of transport (including Mr Incredible’s car). The ‘stations’ are linked by a ‘pixie dust trail’. If a player ends their turn on a station they can choose to move to the next station (using up one point of their dice roll) and so on to move around the board quicker (and to avoid paying rent!).
5. The traditional houses and hotels have been replaced with Fairytale Cottages and Sleeping Beauty castles.
6. It is now possible for a player to be sent to the Castle Verandah instead of to jail.

28480.name: Admiral
28480.description:
Admiral is an abstract, hex-based strategy game with a rock-paper-scissors mechanism.

The theme hinges around a French/British conflict about the South African colonies shortly before World War I. In reality the conflict was averted by the French need of British support against German aggression, but in Admiral it blooms out with a major naval engagement around southern Africa.

Each player controls three ship fleets, consisting of submarines, destroyers and cruisers. Each fleet has a command ship and a command base. If the command ship is sunk or the base is invaded the entire fleet is destroyed and its ships removed. Each player also controls a battleship which commands the entire fleet, and a corresponding fleet base. Sinking the opponents battleship or invading his fleet base wins the game.

On his turn a player may move one ship from each fleet or forgo moving one fleet in order to move the battleship instead. Ships move along the corners of the hexes, submarines in the hexes. Subs can sink cruisers and battleships, destroyers can sink subs, cruisers can sink destroyers and battleships can sink both cruisers and destroyers.

Admiral plays out similar to chess, a chess with four kings, an action point allowance system and a rock-paper-scissors capture mechanism.

The publisher claims Admiral to be playable by 2-6 players but in reality it is a pure two player game.

28481.name: Amazing War Stories: Pulp Action in World War II
boardgameexpansion: .45 Adventure: Crimefighting Action in the Pulp Era
.45 Adventure: Crimefighting Action in the Pulp Era
28481.description:
From the publisher:

Amazing War Stories: Pulp Action in World War II is the second supplement to the .45 Adventure: Crimefighting Action in the Pulp Era rules and covers Pulp-style action set around World War II. It introduces new military archetypes to the game from the greenest GIs to the veteran Super soldiers; Rocket powered troops to Nazi Zombies.

It also provides new abilities and 12 new scenarios for players to start their own two-fisted war action. And half of these scenarios are straight war-time action, heroics, and pulp excitement (without the weird stuff).

But you can use the archetypes for more than just wartime scenarios as well; rocket troops rescuing a scientist, German expeditions to Tibet, and super soldiers sent to the center of the earth are all possible scenarios for which you can use the heroes and villains presented.

So grab your steel pot and M-1 and get ready for some Amazing War Stories!

Expands:

.45 Adventure: Crimefighting Action in the Pulp Era

28482.description:
This expansion to the Disposable Heroes and Coffin For Seven Brothers system adds details for including U.S. Armed forces in your games.

Expands

Disposable Heroes and Coffin For Seven Brothers
28482.name: Disposable Heroes and Coffin for Seven Brothers: Blood and Guts!
boardgameexpansion: Disposable Heroes and Coffin For Seven Brothers

28483.name: Bible Baseball
28483.description:
The Bible teams up with America’s favorite pass time.

Made by Rhythm Band in 1984 for 2 or more players.

Contents include: game board, 4 pawns, 4 card decks (single, double, triple, and home run), and the instructions.

28484.name: Capture
28484.description:
A magnetic travel game.

Made by Pressman in 1990 for 2 players Ages 7 and up.

OBJECT: Capture your opponents’ pieces or occupy one of his red circles to win.

Contents include: game board, 14 magnetic pieces, and the instructions.

28485.name: Challenge USA
28485.description:
Made by Skelton Shelton Nelson in 1979.

Exclusive features of the game include: 7 variations enabling the player to participate at different skill levels, ranging from a simple puzzle, to an entire group participating in an old fashioned history bee; A laminated game board displaying a map of the USA which can be written on and erased; self-check answers; and an opportunity to program your own cards.

Contents include: game board, 2 dice, 50 state puzzle pieces, 4 tokens, instruction booklet, 14 packages of programmed information cards, 1 set of penalty cards, 1 wild card, 1 dead card, 1 7-section card holder, 1 board design strip, claiming circles, East and West land banks, and 4 Liberty Bell tokens.

28486.name: First Superior Planets Revolt
28486.description:
Based on Tani Kosyu's novel and novellette series,"Koukuu-utyuugun-si (history of space army ?)", this game covers the most important episode in the novel.
Outer planets has made a revolt against the Earth. But, it could not be successful according to the novel.
This game simulates this revolt with "War at Sea" system.

1 map (separated into 4 pieces)
2 countersheets
1 rulebook (12 pages)

The website (Japanese) is
http://solger.sblo.jp/article/1087769.html

28487.description:
A campaign pack for 5th edition Warhammer, Circle of Blood introduces a linked series of scenarios featuring the Bretonnian and Undead armies.

Extra rules and special characters are introduced in the campaign pack. Box contents consist of the campaign rulebook; 4 battle scrolls for each player; a roster pad and card buildings used in the scenarios.
28487.name: Warhammer Circle of Blood

28488.name: Gerald Mcboing Boing Game
28488.description:
From the manufactuerer's web site:

Based on the Academy Award winning Dr. Seuss cartoon, and now featured everyday on the Cartoon Network, Gerald McBoing Boing Game is the story of 6-year-old Gerald: an adventurous little boy with a unique talent for speaking only in sound effects. The game allows young children to join Gerald on his adventures both big and small as he honks, whistles, clangs, toots, and cuckoos through his day. The fun game will entertain and teach, using sound association, to engage its younger players.

For 2 or more players Ages 3 - 6.

28489.name: Math Marks the Spot
28489.description:
From the manufacturer's web site:

Shake, roll and race! This oversized mat game will have your kids begging to practice their math. Roll the soft foam numbers and operation dice and race to find the answer on the oversized number mat! This durable vinyl mat features all the answers (sums and differences) to addition and subtraction problems that use numbers 1 through 6. Includes 3 dice and 28 cardboard game markers.

Ages 5 - 8

28490.name: Munch Math Game
28490.description:
For 2 or more players, Ages 7 and up.

This game won the 2004 National Young Game Inventors Contest. Players add, subtract, multiply, and divide to fill up their food cards. At the same time, they must use strategy to slow down their opponents. There are 3 ways to play.

28492.description:
A memory game loosely based on Eric Carle's Brown Bear, Brown Bear, What Do You See? and Panda Bear, Panda Bear, What Do You See? series of children's books.

2-4 players are either brown or panda bears; the pandas are looking for a set of endangered animals, while the browns are looking for a set of more mundane wildlife (albeit a bit weird, such as the blue horse). Each turn a player flips one tile from a center pool. If it fills an opening in their predefined set, they keep it and take one (and only one) more turn. If not, they turn it back over. First player to fill their whole set wins.

The two turn limit makes this more suited to very young children than traditional memory games, as there's never too many recently-flipped tiles to track. Most of the time there's either zero or one, since rejected animals are usually quickly picked up by the next player in line.

Claims that the game helps with sequencing skills are based on the endgame, when the winning player calls out each of their animals in order, aping the book series' style. (The animals can be picked up in any order.)
28492.name: Brown Bear - Panda Bear, What Do You See?

28493.name: Watchamacallit Puzzlewords
28493.description:
Each player thinks of a subject and secretly writes words relating to it on a planner, like a little crossword.

The other players call off positions on the board, finding the letters that make up the words.

By challenging and naming a word before it is complete, players can earn bonus points, but lose points if they are wrong.

Puzzlewords will increase your word power and provoke laughter and discussion all around the table.

28495.name: Monster Under My Bed
28495.description:
From the manufacturer's web site:

Players reach under the bed to find the matches on their score card. The monster gets nervous if a player is looking too long and will growl a warning sign. If a player has their hand under the bed for too long the monster pops out of the head board and that player has to clear off their score card. The first player to find and match three items in a row, wins! Includes 9Wx8Hx12L electronic monster bed, 12 gross objects, 4 score cards, 40 chips, and instructions. No reading required.

Ages 4 and up

28496.name: Spear Song
28496.description:
Spear Song is a set of tabletop wargame rules primarily based on the Dark Age/Medieval period. By concentrating on the 'mechanics' of pre-gunpowder warfare, rather than focusing on particular armies or battles, the system should be flexible enough to cater for the historical preferences of most players who are interested in this era. Rules for chariots and 'Eastern style' warriors further increase the potential by allowing for Celtic or Crusader type settings.

Whilst the rules are mainly designed to create skirmishes and small-scale actions, a section is also included to enable larger scale battles to be fought using the same basic system.

Each major section of the text is followed by a fictional narrative that explains how the system works in game terms, and an introductory scenario based around the narratives is provided to familiarize players with the game.

As with other Dropwing systems, it is intended to extend the historical material that we produce in line with market demand. Having said this, Spear Song provides a 'stand alone' system in it's own right, which provides players with the basic material to fight battles using a wide variety of warriors from the 'Sword and Shield' era.

28497.name: Tamagotchi Electronic Grow Your Pet Game
28497.description:
From the Press Release:

Based on Bandai’s popular line of Tamagotchi virtual pets, this board game allows fans to start out as an egg and try to be the first player to evolve to adulthood. An electronic “Tamascreen” selects players’ meals, toys, snacks and more, and Tamagotchi-themed challenges help players win.

28498.name: Meta
28498.description:
Meta is a gaming system, consisting of a 10x10 board that may be laid down or stood upright and 44 wooden tokens in 3 colors. The 8 dark green tokens are identical on both sides, but the yellow and light green ones have a dot on one of their sides. The components are of excellent quality.

The system comes with four games:
Menos: an evolution of solitaire where the player jumps over the pieces to remove them (for one player).
Esca: a five-in-a-row game, where the board stands upright with the two players on either side. Players try to make 2 5-in-a-rows by placing their tokens, blocking and removing enemy tokens.
Tremplin: a chinese checkers sort of game where players try to reach their respective goals by jumping over pieces. (2 configurations: for 2 or 4 players)
Arriba: an original concept where the board is positioned at an angle. Players try to reach the top row but the holes become deeper and deeper towards it, so multiple tokens have to be positioned in the holes to create stepping stones.

28499.description: A trivia game about Finnish rock music from the 70's to 00's. The game includes a four-piece game board, 180 question cards and a dvd together with about 1000 questions. The dvd contains video and music samples. There are two different playing options: you can either play a quick game or a regular game. The publisher is a Finnish record company.
28499.name: Suomirokkia trivia

28500.name: Terminus V: The Armageddon Vortex
28500.description:
From the publisher's website

Terminus V is an elaborate combination of actual and purely imaginary elements. It’s particularly hard to define where the “real” ends and the “fictional” begins. For those of you who follow military and scientific matters, you’re likely to spot where reality meets fiction-although in some cases, you may not be able to clearly distinguish between these boundaries. However, it really isn't important where the lines blur a bit. The fuzzy area where reality and fiction intermix is intentional. The real fun is in the game itself and what you can (or can’t) make of it to be successful in your mission and/or goals!

You can play T5 strictly as a miniatures game, a roleplaying game, or both simultaneously. As you will see, the Character Profile Log sheets can be filled out and set up to use either way, depending upon the amount of information you want to know, or need to have, about a character. The game can easily be converted into a dual miniatures/roleplaying game simply by choosing to play one character as yourself while the rest of your team (Strike Cell) is played normally as miniatures would be.

T5 is excellent for present-day combat simulation gaming too! The unique and versatile Com20 game system mechanics give you everything you need to game battles taking place today--with no modifications necessary! See the T5 Action! page for additional details.
